intro: Oxytropis siah-sangi, commonly known as the Persian milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its erect growth habit and compound leaves. The plant produces small, pea-like flowers that are typically pale blue or purple in color. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky or sandy soils. Oxytropis siah-sangi is known for its ability to fix atmospheric nitrogen, contributing to soil fertility in its native habitat.
